taxon_name.authority: W. R. Buck & H. A. Crum

taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [For Zennoske Iwatsuki, b. 1929, Japanese bryologist, and Latin -ella , diminutive]

bio:treatment.description: Plants in prostrate mats, yellowish. Stems freely branched; paraphyllia absent. Leaves appressed, imbricate, suborbicular to ovate-lanceolate; margins plane to recurved, entire; apex long-piliferous; ecostate or occasionally costa double, short; alar cells not differentiated; medial laminal cells rhombic to elliptic, smooth, walls thick. Capsule erect, oblong-cylindric, symmetric.

verbatim.text: Species 1: nw North America, Europe, Asia.

bio:treatment.discussion: Sporophytes of Iwatsukiella are rare in North America.
